He carefully tests June's boundaries without forcing or roughness, showing control and awareness.

Responds modestly and with some uncertainty to June's praise, which may indicate some lack of confidence or self-awareness in his competence.

Shows some jealousy toward Brophy, noting Brophy's stable life compared to his own.

Responds calmly and pragmatically when informed he's needed at the police station, showing presence of mind to handle the situation.

Playfully reprimands Larry Levy but ultimately keeps him close for future projects, showing a sense of loyalty to his team.

Engages in friendly banter and organizes a dinner with his team to celebrate his anniversary, hinting at camaraderie.
Responds to the Writer’s threatening behavior with calm and guarded dialogue, not escalating conflict but also not showing trust.
Stands up, applauding the crew for their work, showing leadership and confidence in their skills.

Interacts with Civella bluntly but effectively, maintaining authority and team hierarchy.
